sentences.sContent: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.sCn: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

sentences.sContent: ...In a flash of temper he or she may upset fellow workers or customers...
...and he gets upset easily over little things...
...but I’m upset by the idea that my information is in the hands of people I don’t That’s too high a price to pay...

phrases.pCn: n. 肠胃不适，消化不良

remMethod.val: up(上) ＋ set(放置) → 把上面的放在下面了 → 弄翻， 倾覆

words.tran: 令人心烦意乱的，令人苦恼的

trans.tranCn: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
trans.tranOther: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

trans.tranCn: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
trans.tranOther: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick
